result.name: 1994-1994-centre-for-environment-fisheries-aquaculture-science-cefas-national-marine-monitoring
result.notes:
A series of cruises were carried out in the North Sea, English Channel and 
Irish Sea between 1992 and 1997 by the Centre for Environment, Fisheries and 
Aquaculture Science to conduct monitoring studies at stations established 
under the UK National Monitoring Programme (NMP). Physical measurements were 
taken as well as the collection of samples for chemical and biological effects 
studies. This data consists of the station locations sampled in 1994, 
ancillary data recorded (e.g. salinity, temperature), and some analysis data 
of sediment and water bottle samples.

organization.name: centre-for-environment-fisheries-aquaculture-science
organization.title: Centre for Environment, Fisheries & Aquaculture Science
organization.description: The Centre for Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture Science (Cefas) is a world leader in marine science and technology, providing innovative solutions for the aquatic environment, biodiversity and food security.
